ResearchProjectDef.label: Double action
ResearchProjectDef.description: An improved upon version of the single action mechanism allowing the hammer to be cocked and release with a single trigger pull usually used in revolvers.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Break action
ResearchProjectDef.description: A type of action when the gun "breaks" in half and cartridges or shells are loaded directly into the cylinder or barrel.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Pump action
ResearchProjectDef.description: A type of action where you manipulate the handguard and "pump" it back and forth to to eject a spent casing and then load in a new round.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Lever action
ResearchProjectDef.description: A type of action where you manipulate the trigger guard forward and back like a lever to eject and load a new round.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Bolt action
ResearchProjectDef.description: A type of action where you manipulate the bolt in order to cycle rounds from a magazine.

ResearchProjectDef.label: High caliber
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to handle the high pressures of high caliber rounds.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Self loading and recoil operation
ResearchProjectDef.description: allows creation of firearms that use the recoil of the barrel to cycle the next round from a magazine.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Self loading shotguns
ResearchProjectDef.description: allows creation of shotguns that dont require manipulation of a bolt, pump, or other action to cycle rounds.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Sub machine guns
ResearchProjectDef.description: Allows creation of full auto firearms that use pistol calibers.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Selective fire
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create firearms using intermidiate cartridges that have full auto and/or burst capabilities commonly refered to as "Assault Rifles" and "Battle Rifles".

ResearchProjectDef.label: Flame throwers
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create Firearms that spew flammable liquid that is ignited as it leaves the barrel.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Light machine guns
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create light machine guns that can fire for prolonged periods of time without overheating or reloading.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Ammunition belts
ResearchProjectDef.description: connect a large amount of rounds together with cheap metal links into a "belt".

ResearchProjectDef.label: Polymer
ResearchProjectDef.description: learn the about the creation of polymer for use in firearms (kinda just a techblock for now, eventually(tm) will have actual polymer to make guns with).

ResearchProjectDef.label: Bakelite framing
ResearchProjectDef.description: replace parts of guns with polymer/bakelite, which are lower weight compared to wood/steel.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Advanced gun furniture
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create foregrips and other attachtments for use on firearms.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Lenses
ResearchProjectDef.description: learn how to make lenses for use in optical sights and targeting systems.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Simple scopes
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create basic scopes for long range shooting.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Modern scopes
ResearchProjectDef.description: Create modern scopes for long range shooting.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Caseless ammunition
ResearchProjectDef.description: Craft weapons using caseless ammuniton which is lighter and cheaper compared to cased rounds.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Optical targeting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to make optical targeting systems for use in automated weaponry like turrets.
